results.title: The Reef at Michaelmas Cay
results.creator_credit: Douglas Steen Productions and Douglas B. Steen
results.brief_description: Shows a party of divers exploring marine life at Michaelmas Cay, a Great Barrier Reef island near Cairns. Includes scenes of giant clams, razor fish, stone fish, butterfly cod, moray eels, and green turtles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Steen Productions and Douglas B. Steen

results.title: The Redwoods
results.creator_credit: King Screen Productions, Mark Harris and Trevor Greenwood
results.brief_description: Sequoia Semperivirens, the giant everlasting redwood, is a link with the age of the dinosaurs. But the future of these trees is threatened. This film, a tribute to nature’s awesome power to create, is also a testament of man’s reckless power to destroy, and it pleads for the establishment of a Redwood National Park in the United States. Narrated by William Turner and Keith Griggs.

results.title: The Redman and the child
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A noble Sioux avenges the murder of an old white man who had been his friend. Based on the novel by Bret Harte. Cast includes Charles Inslee, John Tansey, Linda Arvidson, George Gebhardt, Harry Solter. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Red stain
results.brief_description: Presents a parable in animation art on weaponry and peace, demonstrating the power of love, the victory of flowers over machine and the indestructibility of a child. No other credits available.

results.title: The Red squirrel = La Ardilla roja [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: The Red squirrel is a stylish thriller about stolen identity set in modern day Spain. Jota is a former rock musician contemplating suicide when he witnesses a motorcycle accident. Rushing to assist the victim, Jota discovers that Lisa has amnesia and in a ruse to stay close to her, he convinces Lisa that she is his fiancee. Complications ensue when the couple visit a campground named The Red Squirrel and Lisa’s memory starts to return, as does her ex-husband. At the campground Lisa and Jota encounter a myriad of characters, who compound the sense of deception and duplicity that pervades the film. Directed with humour and flair by Julio Medem, “The Red squirrel” has much in common with Hitchcock’s “Vertigo” in that is explores the territory of a man shaping his ideal woman out of a person he (wrongly) perceives to be an empty vessel. At times “The Red squirrel” mocks the idea of machismo; in particular Jota’s rock star posturing and the chauvinistic overtures of an obnoxious male neighbour at the camp. The game within the game is what drives the narrative and keeps the audience guessing as to who is telling, or even knows, the truth. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Red pony
results.creator_credit: Charles K Felman Group and Lewis Milestone
results.brief_description: John Steinbeck’s classic is brought to life with an outstanding cast and a fine script. It is a tender, moving story about the conflict between a nine year old boy, his father and the family’s hired hand. A small red pony becomes the focal point of the complex human relationships at the ranch and is the catalyst for the boy’s growth into manhood. Starring Myrna Loy and Robert Mitchum.

results.title: The Red kite
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: A tale taken from a collection of short stories by Canadian author Hugh Hood. The setting is Montreal, and the story simply about a red kite that a man buys for his young daughter. This mildly impulsive act leads to encounters with strangers that cause him to wonder about the whole purpose and meaning of life. The bitter-sweet mood of the film and the setting, Montreal in late summer, creates a strangely haunting view of the city and of time.

results.title: The Red carpet
results.brief_description: When the red carpet is rolled out at the Hotel Bellevue in preparation for the arrival of the Duke of Sultana, it just keeps on rolling. Happy, lively music, continuous action, and a humorous, rhyming text keeps pace with the carpet as it criss-crosses the town and finally arrives at the ferry, just in time for the Duke’s arrival. Good for language development. Based on the book of the sane name by Rex Parkin, published in 1948. Suitable for children aged 4-8.
